children.text: Okay, I need to translate these two Java programs into a single Fortran program that does the same thing as the original sequence.
children.label: language_mapping

children.text: Let me start by understanding what each Java program does.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: First, the first Java program (atcoder_ABC169_D) takes a long integer n from input.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: It calculates the square root of n, then iterates from 2 to that square root.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: For each i, it counts how many times i divides n, then uses a loop to add to the answer based on the count.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: Finally, if there's any remaining n (greater than 1), it adds one more to the answer. The output is the answer.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: The second Java program (atcoder_ABC135_D) reads a string of characters, which can include '?', and computes some DP array modulo 1e9+7.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: The DP tracks the remainder mod 13 as digits are processed from right to left.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: The final output is the count of numbers ending with remainder 5 mod 13.

Now, in Fortran code:

                    ! The entire program would be:

                    program main

                        implicit none

                        integer(8) :: n, answer, sqrt_n, temp, count, j, i

                        integer :: MOD = 10**9 +7

                        character(len=20) :: s

                        integer :: L

                        integer(8), allocatable :: dp(:,:)

                        ! First part: compute answer

                        read(*,*) n

                        sqrt_n = int(sqrt(real(n,8))) answer =0

                        do i=2, sqrt_n

                            count =0

                            temp = n

                            do while (mod(temp, i) ==0)

                                temp = temp/ i

                                count = count +1

                            end do

                            if (count >0) then

                                j=1

                                do while (count -j >=0) answer = answer +1

                                    count = count -j

                                    j = j +1

                                end do

                            end if

                            n = temp

                        end do

                        if (n >1) then

                            answer = answer +1

                        end if

                        ! Convert answer to string s

                        write(s, '(i0)') answer

                        s = adjustl(s)  ! remove leading spaces

                        L = len_trim(s)

                        ! Second part: process s through DP

                        allocate(dp(0:L-1, 0:12))

                        dp = 0

                        integer(8) :: base =1

                        integer :: current_char, next_digit, pre, new_remainder

                        do i=0, L-1

                            current_char = ichar(s(L -i: L -i))  ! get the (L-i)th character (from the end)

                            if (current_char == ichar('?')) then

                                ! process all digits 0-9

                                integer(8), dimension(0:12) :: temp_dp

                                temp_dp = 0

                                do pre=0,12

                                    integer(8) :: prev_count

                                    if (i ==0) then

                                        if (pre ==0) then

                                            prev_count =1

                                        else

                                            prev_count =0

                                        end if

                                    else

                                        prev_count = dp(i-1, pre)

                                    end if

                                    do next_digit=0,9

                                        new_remainder = mod( base * next_digit + pre, 13 )

                                        temp_dp(new_remainder) = temp_dp(new_remainder) + prev_count

                                        temp_dp(new_remainder) = mod(temp_dp(new_remainder), MOD)

                                    end do

                                end do

                                dp(i,:) = temp_dp(:)

                            else

                                ! current_char is a digit

                                next_digit = current_char - ichar('0')

                                integer(8), dimension(0:12) :: temp_dp

                                temp_dp =0

                                do pre=0,12

                                    integer(8) :: prev_count

                                    if (i ==0) then

                                        if (pre ==0) then

                                            prev_count =1

                                        else

                                            prev_count =0

                                        end if

                                    else

                                        prev_count = dp(i-1, pre)

                                    end if

                                    new_remainder = mod( base * next_digit + pre, 13 )

                                    temp_dp(new_remainder) = temp_dp(new_remainder) + prev_count

                                    temp_dp(new_remainder) = mod(temp_dp(new_remainder), MOD)

                                end do

                                dp(i,:) = temp_dp(:)

                            end if

                            ! Update base for next iteration

                            base = mod( base *10, 13 )

                        end do

                        !

Okay, I need to translate these two Java programs into a single Fortran program that does the same thing as the original sequence. Let me start by understanding what each Java program does.

First, the first Java program (atcoder_ABC169_D) takes a long integer n from input. It calculates the square root of n, then iterates from 2 to that square root. For each i, it counts how many times i divides n, then uses a loop to add to the answer based on the count. Finally, if there's any remaining n (greater than 1), it adds one more to the answer. The output is the answer.
